Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
`So hashrate is what secures the chain, but nodes are what validate it? `
yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all nodes validate that all blocks (and transactions in blocks) are valid

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it is invalid, it will reject it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now with enough hashrate, you can reorg the chain and what was once valid can become invalid, and what was invalid can become valid

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: hashrate mines the blocks, but it cannot mine illegal blocks

Author: Tek#5253
Content: few months ago , the mining pools on BCH reversed a transaction.

Author: Tek#5253
Content: it wasnt a 51% attack

Author: Tek#5253
Content: as it was over 80% of hash that decided

Author: Tek#5253
Content: if not all hash

Author: Tek#5253
Content: that decided

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what they did was reorged the chain and SPENT the funds in the "correct" way

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: due to the anybodycan spend rule, so it was a valid tx in the reorged chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once it is spent, you cant double spend it, as that would be illegal

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: however it was a special case due to new rules going into effect for not protecting against the spend

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in legacy coin, they wont every make such changes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so you cant practically censor a tx forever

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: eventually some miner will mine the "evil" tx, especially if it has a big txfee (bribery attack) and it gets confirmed
